title: Australian shares end flat as miners counter energy, consumer losses
description: Australian shares ended Monday flat. Iron ore miners saw gains, while consumer discretionary and energy stocks declined. Trading volumes were notably low. Asian markets, however, experienced a significant surge, reaching record highs driven by artificial intelligence optimism. Australian equities did not mirror this trend. Miners climbed, while energy stocks reversed earlier gains. Interest rate-sensitive sectors faced pressure.
content:

title: Aravind Srinivas issues stark warning: Multi-billion data centers may soon become obsolete, Perplexity CEO flags 'biggest threat'
description: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas has warned that massive data centers for which big tech giants Meta, Amazon, Microsoft and others are pouring billions of dollars may become irrelevant in the future. He mentioned that the biggest threat to traditional data centres is if AI “can be packed locally on a chip that's running on the device”. Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas highlighted a future where artificial intelligence (AI) shifts from centralised servers to local devices.
content:

title: Vijay’s 'Jana Nayagan' Faces Flak For AI Use In Trailer: 5 Films Caught In AI Controversies
description: The use of artificial intelligence in movies continues to be a subject of intense debate. title: Banks, e-commerce platforms ramp up safeguards as online scams evolve
description: Industry players say better checks are needed as scammers increasingly use artificial intelligence to mimic legitimate transactions.
content: SINGAPORE: From tighter identity checks and real-time payment alerts to in-app advisories and transaction nudges, banks and e-commerce platforms in Singapore say they have strengthened targeted anti-scam measures, as fraud tactics grow more sophistic... [6055 chars]

title: AI Godfather Yoshua Bengio warns against giving rights to AI, says humans could lose control
description: AI pioneer Yoshua Bengio has cautioned against granting rights to artificial intelligence, warning that doing so could leave humans without the ability to control or shut down advanced AI systems.
content: AI Godfather Yoshua Bengio has just sounded an alarm to people against giving Artificial Intelligence rights. In an interview with The Guardian Yoshua Bengio hinted that giving rights to AI will be similar to “giving citizenship to extra terrestials”... [2054 chars]

title: Lamborghini says AI is inevitable in car manufacturing - even for low-volume supercars
description: The Italian exotic automaker says artificial intelligence will inevitably be used to make all cars, even low-volume models like its own – and it's already using the technology.
content:
The use of artificial intelligence (AI) in building cars is inevitable, according to Lamborghini, even among smaller specialised automakers – like the Italian exotic brand – that still hand-make some components.
